lattice

Class ImplicationalSystemWriterText

  • java.lang.Object
    • lattice.ImplicationalSystemWriterText

  • public final class ImplicationalSystemWriterText
extends java.lang.Object

    This class defines the way for writing an implicational system as a text file.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static ImplicationalSystemWriterText getInstance()
      Return the singleton instance of this class.
      static void register()
      Register this class for writing .txt files.
      void write(ImplicationalSystem system, java.io.BufferedWriter file)
      Saves this component in a file.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ImplicationalSystemWriterText getInstance()

        Return the singleton instance of this class.

        Returns:
        the singleton instance

      • register

        public static void register()

        Register this class for writing .txt files.

      • write

        public void write(ImplicationalSystem system,
         java.io.BufferedWriter file)
           throws java.io.IOException

        Saves this component in a file.

        The following format is used:

        An implicational system can be instancied from and save to a text file in the following format: A list of elements separated by a space in the first line ; then, each rule on a line, written like [premise] -> [conclusion] where elements are separated by a space.

        a b c d e
a b -> c d
c d -> e
        Parameters:
        system - a system to write
        file - a file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When an IOException occurs
